thread.title: More hikers stranded on Grouse Mountain
thread.title_full: More hikers stranded on Grouse Mountain - NEWS 1130

author: NEWS 1130 Staff
title: More hikers stranded on Grouse Mountain
text:
Summary North Shore Rescue spent last night bringing in four stranded hikers
Record number of calls to North Shore Rescue this year
NORTH VANCOUVER (NEWS 1130) – Another busy weekend for North Shore Rescue . The team was called out a couple of times last night to rescue four stranded hikers.
Two people got stuck on Grouse Mountain, while another pair got lost in the Lynn Headwaters area.
Jim Loree with the team says the couple on Grouse were students from Japan that underestimated the trail. “They were definitely not prepared. They just basically had your typical street clothes and weren’t familiar with the terrain at all.”
Loree says crews are exhausted after a record number of calls this year “I think we are at 118 calls now for the year after last night and we really do want to get the message out to please be prepared when you are going into the back-country. Research the area where you are going, take the proper equipment.”
None of the lost hikers were hurt.
